definition: to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
(onom.) for humming or whimpering
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鳥喙啄了幾下就讓這條蛇一命嗚呼了。

sentences.english: If it had hit them, they could have all been killed.
sentences.chinese: 如果當時真打中他們，他們可能全都一命嗚呼。

sentences.english: A bullet through the heart ended her.
sentences.chinese: 一粒子彈穿心過肺，使她一命嗚呼。

sentences.english: He died of a broken neck.
It was enough to give a cheer last month when he rasped his last sour breath.
sentences.chinese: 就那次足以讓我爲他上個月的一命嗚呼歡呼了。

sentences.english: Some evening night returns, rance encounters a serious traffic accident, result die.
sentences.chinese: 某晚夜歸，蘭斯遭遇一場嚴重車禍，結果一命嗚呼。

definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
dejected/despondent/depressed
sullen/to scowl miserably
red in the face/extremely angry
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
argumentative/quarrelsome
filthy speech/obscenities
equestrianism/horsemanship
